or fewer row switch to larger needles and rearrange stitches so that there are 13 14 15 16 17 sts on needles one and three and 26 28 30 32 34 sts on needle 2 and get ready to start the heel copyright needle one slip the same number of sts from the third needle onto the opposite end of needle four this will become the needle you will knit your heel on you will now have 26 28 30 32 34 sts on this needle for the heel divide the sts that remain in half and slip them onto two needles evenly you will have 13 14 15 16 17 sts on each of the other two needles you will not be knitting on these again until after you complete the heel flap knit the heel flap using your free needle and with the wrong side facing you complete the heel sts as follows row 1 wrong side sl 1 p to end row 2 * sl 1 k1 * repeat to end repeat row 1 and 2 for 2 2 2 ¼ 2 ¼ 2 ½ repeat row 1 one more time turn the heel row 1 right side k15 16 17 18 19 sts k2tog k1 turn row 2 sl1 purlwise p5 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1 knitwise k6 k2tog k1 turn row 4 sl1 purlwise p7 p2tog p1 turn row 5 sl1 knitwise k8 k2tog k1 turn continue working this pattern by working one more stitch before the decrease on each row until all of the stitches have been worked your last decrease row will be a purl row knit one more row you will have 16 16 18 18 20 sts remaining on the needle gusset using your free needle pick up and k12 12 16 16 16 sts down the left side of the heel combine the sts on the next two needles by slipping them onto one needle there should be 26 28 30 32 34 sts on this needle on needle two * k1 tbl * repeat from * to remaining sts from the heel needle onto the first needle you should have 20 20 25 25 26 sts on the first and third
